trans-unit.source:
\n

Provides access to unmanaged blocks of memory from managed code.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The user does not have the required permission.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A pointer to an unmanaged memory location.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxx xx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the memory to use.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The user does not have the required permission.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The pointer value is null.

\n

trans-unit.source:
The length value is less than zero.

- or -

The length is large enough to cause an overflow.

\n

trans-unit.source:
The length value is less than zero.

- or -

The capacity value is less than zero.

- or -

The length value is greater than the capacity value.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer to contain the unmanaged memory stream.

trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte position in the buffer at which to start the unmanaged memory stream.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the unmanaged memory stream.

\n

The buffer to contain the unmanaged memory stream.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte position in the buffer at which to start the unmanaged memory stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the unmanaged memory stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The mode of file access to the unmanaged memory stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether a stream supports reading.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: false if the object was created by a constructor with an access parameter that did not include reading the stream and if the stream is closed; otherwise, true.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether a stream supports seeking.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: false if the stream is closed; otherwise, true.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether a stream supports writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: false if the object was created by a constructor with an access parameter value that supports writing or was created by a constructor that had no parameters, or if the stream is closed; otherwise, true.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxxx$ xx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the stream length (size) or the total amount of memory assigned to a stream (capacity).

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx $xxxx$ xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxx $xxxxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The size or capacity of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx.$$x$$x

The length of the data in the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The current position in the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets a byte pointer to a stream based on the current position in the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx x xxxx xxxxxxx xx x xxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A byte pointer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The current position is larger than the capacity of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The position is being set is not a valid position in the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xx xxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The pointer is being set to a lower value than the starting position of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xx x xxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

\n

The buffer to contain the unmanaged memory stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads the specified number of bytes into the specified array.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ $ $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ $ 0$ xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This parameter is passed uninitialized.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx$xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to read from the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxx $0$ xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer parameter is set to null.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset parameter is less than zero.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
- or -

The count parameter is less than zero.
trans-unit.target: $$x$$x$x$$ xx $ $$x$$x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the buffer array minus the offset parameter is less than the count parameter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxx xxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
Asynchronously reads the specified number of bytes into the specified array.

Available starting in .NET Framework 4.6
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx .XXX Xxxxxxxxx 0.0$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer to write the data into.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte offset in buffer at which to begin writing data from the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to read.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxx $xx$XXxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xx xx xxx xx 0 $xxxx$ xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a byte from a stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxx xxxx x xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx$ xx xxxxxxx $0 xx xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
The underlying memory does not support reading.

- or -

The current position is at the end of the stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x$x$$ xx $$$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets the current position of the current stream to the given value.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The point relative to origin to begin seeking from.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The new position in the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An attempt was made to seek before the beginning of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset value is larger than the maximum size of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: loc is invalid.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets the length of a stream to a specified value.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx x xxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error has occurred.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx X$X xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
The specified value exceeds the capacity of the stream.

- or -

The specified value is negative.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x$x$$ xx $$$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Writes a block of bytes to the current stream using data from a buffer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx x xxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxx x xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte array from which to copy bytes to the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset in the buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of bytes to write to the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error occurs.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx X$X xxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

One of the specified parameters is less than zero.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset parameter minus the length of the buffer parameter is less than the count parameter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer parameter is null.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.

Available starting in .NET Framework 4.6
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx .XXX Xxxxxxxxx 0.0$$x$$x

\n

The buffer to write data from.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer from which to begin copying bytes to the stream.

\n

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:

A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Writes a byte to the current position in the file stream.

\n

The stream is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The supplied value causes the stream exceed its maximum capacity.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x
